title: The Mysterious Death at the Art Gallery

victim.name: Oliver Stone
victim.description: A tall man with black hair and green eyes. He was wearing a blue blazer and black pants.

crimeScene: The art gallery was closed when the murder occurred. There were a number of paintings and sculptures on display. The victim was found near one of the paintings.

suspects.name: Sophia Rogers
suspects.description: A petite woman with blonde hair and blue eyes. She was wearing a black dress and high heels.
suspects.alibi: She was in her studio, which is located on the other side of town, at the time of the murder.
suspects.story: Sophia and Oliver were business partners in a new art venture. But she felt that Oliver was not giving her enough credit for the success of the venture. She also found out that Oliver was secretly planning to cut her out of the venture and keep all the profits for himself.

suspects.name: David Johnson
suspects.description: A tall man with brown hair and brown eyes. He was wearing a white shirt and black pants.
suspects.alibi: He was at home with his wife at the time of the murder.
suspects.story: David is a famous art collector and was very interested in the painting next to which Oliver was found dead. He had been bidding for it for weeks, but Oliver refused to sell it to him. David was furious and felt that Oliver was intentionally blocking him from acquiring the painting.

suspects.name: Madison Lee
suspects.description: A young woman with red hair and hazel eyes. She was wearing a green dress and sandals.
suspects.alibi: She was at the theater watching a movie at the time of the murder.
suspects.story: Madison was a struggling artist who had been trying to get her work exhibited at the art gallery for months. But Oliver kept rejecting her work, and she felt that he was not taking her seriously as an artist. She was very angry with him and had threatened to harm him in the past.

suspects.name: Michael Brown
suspects.description: A muscular man with black hair and brown eyes. He was wearing a grey suit and a red tie.
suspects.alibi: He was at a business meeting at the time of the murder.
suspects.story: Michael was another business partner of Oliver's. But he was more interested in the business side of things and had been pushing for more aggressive marketing tactics to increase sales. Oliver was against this idea and the two had frequent arguments about it.

truth.name: Michael Brown
truth.how: Michael killed Oliver using a letter opener from Oliver's desk. He snuck up on him from behind and stabbed him in the chest. He then carefully placed the letter opener back on the desk to make it look like it had not been moved.
truth.why: Michael was tired of Oliver's resistance to his marketing ideas and felt that the company was not growing as fast as it could. He also felt that Oliver was not giving him enough credit for the company's success. In a fit of rage, he decided to kill Oliver and take control of the company himself.

prologue: Oliver Stone, one of the most successful art collectors in the city, has been found dead in his own gallery. As a detective, it is your job to find out who killed him and bring the perpetrator to justice. The suspects are all connected to the art world in some way and all had motives to kill Oliver. Can you solve the case and bring the killer to justice?
